result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo Escobedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time if imposed.
Consecutive to: Cases 16CM700 and 15CM2079

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

No Contact with Wendy D. or her residence, Misty W. or her residence, Scott s. or Ernie E. (except for contact through court order for visitation purposes). Provide DNA Specmen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through and complete Alliance Counseling. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
To be performed as a condition of probation, as directed by agent on each case.
Consecutive to: Cases 15CM2079 & 16CM700

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo Escobedo

Defendant Ricardo Escobedo in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties have reached a global resolution on all three cases. The Defendant is sworn in and waives his right to a jury trial. The Court sets a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 with the condition of absolute sobriety.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
